Articles.Content:
Did this one this afternoon in Photoshop, wasn't happy with the composition however.

and a different composition, still not happy...

Criticism welcome

Edited June 28, 2013 by Vostok

I think one of the big issues is the lack of consistency from the color of the campfire to the color reflected on his face... Green fire reflects red-orange on a green Kerbal? What? Otherwise I think it's very nice, I like the look of the fire and smoke from the rocket.
yes, your fire is the characteristic yellow-green shade of burning logs wrapped in copper wire (the campfire, not the rocket.

Wait what... the fire is green?

<----Colourblind

Yep, the fire's green. Still, excellent job even with your colorblindness!
also, the smoke looks kinda scribbled in, that was the only thing that bugged me about it. its excellent artwork!
I changed the first one slightly, This time I took yellow from google images :/ I agree with the smoke comment, I think I'l fix that too.
Amazing! What did you use to make these?
Green?! All i see in that fire is browns and yellows, you guys must be colorblind!

Green?! All i see in that fire is browns and yellows, you guys must be colorblind!

No.... It's green...
It's like yellow-green-ish, then a dark orange-brown? With white.

Green?! All i see in that fire is browns and yellows, you guys must be colorblind!

do you mean the campfire? thats green. the rocket is brown and yellows though.

This is where the infinite fuel of the infinite fuel cheat comes from.

I think it may not be a composition issue, so much as one with the angle the kerbal is facing. It's confusing, is he supposed to be looking at the fire, or rocket, or neither?

That could be throwing of the feel of the work.

do you mean the campfire? thats green. the rocket is brown and yellows though.

The campfire is brown and yellowish while the rocket stuff is more of a red hue.
